lexUnit.name: rasp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a harsh, grating noise.

sentence.text: ` Ye would n't listen to me , would ye ! " he rasped .
` Mr Quick , " he rasped , ` welcome to Noir et Blanc .
Maxim pressed the entryphone bell for Winkelmann and waited until a man 's voice rasped : ` Bitte ? "
` I did not say that ! " he rasped suddenly , glaring at her .
` I wish to hold a meeting , " Benjamin rasped .
` What makes you think that could be the case ? " he rasped irritably .
` What is it , Brother ? " he rasped .
` You 'll what ? " rasped Lucenzo , his fingers biting into her arms .
Sycorax would not reply except to rasp her curses .
Are n't you going to produce it ? " he rasped out .
He rasped out the words and stood with his hands on his hips to glare down at her .
` Why ? " he rasped again as his eyes scoured her face for an answer .
` Because of your love for Steve ? " he rasped angrily at her bitter betrayal .
Startlingly , then , a voice rasped in an American accent : ` War is a sonofabitch .
` Do n't you have any legs ? " he suddenly rasped , his hands on his lean hips , his black eyes running over her in exasperation .
